answers.answer: Personally, I feel this decision is way too important to look for guidance from people on an online website. You seem to be raising good questions about the decision to treat or amputate and I would ask for a second opinion from a qualified specialist. Ask for your questions to be explained in clear language so that you are comfortable with the reasoning behind the decision.

There are several options that should be considered before amputation. And they should be considered as of yesterday.Hyperbaric oxygen (in a chamber) is available at few hospitals, but has been used as a treatment to prevent amputation. Try this route immediately. Nicotine patches are also being experimentally used.That being said, for them to suggest amputation there is a life-threatening problem. If the infection proceeds there may be no  choice but to amputate the leg.

title: Infected foot
